rules: Rule1: Provided that the production is over budget, the production is successful.
Rule2: Under the condition that the production is over budget, the production is not successful.

Rule3: Either the production is over budget or, if it is not the case that failing to monitor the weather by the crew leading to the crew not evacuating implies that filming does not continue, then the production wraps.
Rule4: If the production secures a sponsor, then the production is profitable.
Rule5: Whenever the production finds an investor, the production is profitable.
Rule6: Provided that the footage is delivered to the network, the production is profitable.
Rule7: Under the condition that the content is streamed on a platform, the production is profitable.
Rule8: Whenever the producer negotiates with the network, the producer signs a deal.
Rule9: Either the producer negotiates with the network or the producer contacts the platform.

Rule10: If the producer contacts the platform, then, under the condition that distribution requires the content, either the footage is delivered to the network or the content is streamed on a platform.
Rule11: Provided that the film crew has a permit for the location, the location is accessible.
Rule12: Under the condition that the producer signs a deal, the producer fulfills the contract.
Rule13: If the production hires an editor, then the deadline is met.
Rule14: Either the production hires an editor or the crew works overtime.

Rule15: If the producer approves overtime, then, under the condition that the crew works overtime, if it is not the case that failing to secure a sponsor or find an investor leads to the production not being bankrupt, then the deadline is extended.

Rule16: Provided that the production pays bonuses, if the crew works overtime, then, whenever it is not the case that failing to secure a sponsor or find an investor implies the production is not bankrupt, the deadline is extended.
Rule17: Under the condition that the location is accessible, the location is not safe.
Rule18: If the production rents a helicopter, then either a helicopter is available or the production is profitable.
Rule19: Either the production rents a helicopter or the production borrows a helicopter.
Rule20: Whenever it is not the case that shooting the storm by the film crew leads to the production being profitable, the producer does not cancel the shoot.

Rule21: If it is not the case that either the scene with lions is completed or, failing to borrow a helicopter by the production implying a helicopter is available or the production is profitable leads to the shoot being delayed, then the footage with lions is edited.
Rule22: If it is not the case that either the production secures a sponsor or the production finds an investor, then the production is bankrupt.

Rule23: If it is not the case that fulfilling the contract by the producer implies that, whenever distribution requires the content, either the footage is delivered to the network or the content is streamed on a platform, then the producer breaches the contract.

Rule24: Provided that it is not the case that fulfilling the contract by the producer leads to, under the condition that distribution requires the content, either the footage is delivered to the network or the content is streamed on a platform, the producer does not breach the contract.
Rule25: If it is not the case that either the producer approves overtime or the production pays bonuses, then the production fails.
Rule26: Whenever it is not the case that the location being accessible implies the location is safe, the producer reschedules the shoot.
Rule27: Provided that it is not the case that borrowing a helicopter by the production leads to either a helicopter being available or the production being profitable, the shoot is not delayed.

Rule28: If it is not the case that failing to have shooting the storm by the film crew imply the production is profitable leading to the producer canceling the shoot, then the film crew has a permit for the location.
Rule29: Under the condition that it is not the case that failing to have monitoring the weather by the crew imply the weather is not dangerous leading to the crew evacuating, filming continues.
Rule30: Whenever it is not the case that failing to secure a sponsor or find an investor leads to the production not being bankrupt, the deadline is not extended.

Rule31: Under the condition that it is not the case that failing to have failing to secure a sponsor or find an investor imply the production is not bankrupt leading to the deadline being extended, the contract is terminated.
Rule32: If the production is not profitable, then the weather is dangerous.
Rule33: Provided that the production is not profitable, the crew monitors the weather.
facts: Fact1: The film crew shoots the storm.
Fact3: It is not the case that the scene with lions is completed.
Fact4: The footage with lions is not edited.
Fact5: The crew does not evacuate.
Fact6: The production does not wrap.
Fact7: The contract is not terminated.
Fact8: The deadline is not met.
Fact9: The production does not fail.
Fact10: The producer does not reschedule the shoot.
Fact11: A helicopter is not available.
